title: Khloe Kardashian confronts Kris Jenner over awkward Lamar Odom meeting
text:
Lamar was caught on camera confronting Khloe in 2015 (Pictures: REX)

Khloe Kardashian is convinced her mother, Kris Jenner, set-up an awkward chance encounter with her ex-husband Lamar Odom.

In the latest episode of Keeping Up With the Kardashians, Khloe, 35, confronts her mum about an incident in 2015 when Lamar, 39, somehow ‘bumped’ into the reality star outside her gym in the early hours of the morning.

The incident was highly-publicised at the time and came in the midst of the pair’s divorce, just a month after they signed papers.

In his recent autobiography, Lamar claimed it was Kris, 65, who told him where Khloe would be that morning but the momager strongly denies it.

During Sunday night’s KUWTK episode, Kris said: ‘It was a huge deal at the time because Lamar popped up at one of Khloe’s classes and it caused a big commotion.

‘Khloe blames me, thinking I told him where she was going to be. That never happened.’

Despite her protestations, Khloe is convinced that Kris did orchestrate the awkward incident and shared her suspicions.

‘The only reason I feel like my mum did disclose my whereabouts is because how would Lamar know where I was going at 5:30 in the morning,’ Khloe questioned.

‘I don’t think my mum realises the severity of the emotional distress Lamar was on during that time. I think she just kind of retreated and got nervous to admit that she potentially put me in harm’s way.’

Kris admitted to Scott Disick that she feared Khloe was ‘literally going to like, come for her’, to which the reality star later replied: ‘Guess what? I am.’

Since that uncomfortable incident, Khloe and Lamar have found themselves in the same Hollywood spot seemingly by coincidence.

Most recently, the pair were seen partying separately at Hyde in West Hollywood earlier this month, risking another awkward encounter. Khloe was enjoying the night with her younger sister Kylie Jenner, while Lamar was accompanied by his new girlfriend Sabrina Parr.
